title: Mathematics Instructional Design for Integrating Universal Design for Learning (UDL) and Common Core State Standards (CCSS)

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics education theory and understanding of basic instructional design principles
context.additional_context: A process where pre-service teachers experience inclusive lesson design reflecting CCSS (Common Core State Standards) math standards using the UDL (Universal Design for Learning) framework. Strengthening competencies in developing and evaluating teachable materials applicable to real classrooms via digital tools and PBL (Project-Based Learning).

learning_goals: Learners can design lesson plans integrating the three UDL principles (engagement, representation, action & expression) with CCSS mathematics standards
Learners can develop math project assignments considering diverse learner needs using PBL approaches and establish implementation plans
Learners can design digital device-based assessment rubrics to present measurable indicators of learning outcomes in UDL-based projects

resources: Digital Educational Tools (Google Workspace, Padlet, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
